alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 23 at 12:58PM CST until January 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents becoming dangerous south to north longshore currents Tuesday morning. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Increasingly intense rip currents this afternoon and overnight due to persistent and building easterly swell perpendicular to the beach, with worst conditions near the Isla Blanca jetty. Currents becoming strong south to north longshore by daybreak Tuesday and continuing through the afternoon with rough and dangerous surf.
info.instruction: If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. In a longshore current on Tuesday, don`t panic. Swim toward shore in the direction of the breaking waves. If you are uncertain of swimming ability, only enter the water to knee-deep.
